intro: Dipcadi ausense, commonly known as the narrowleaf buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers with five petals and a hairy stem. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. Dipcadi ausense is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in early spring.
